meanings.definition: One who tastes food or drink to assess its flavor.
meanings.sent1: The taster carefully sampled the soup to judge its taste.
meanings.sent2: The wine taster swirled the glass before taking a sip.
meanings.sent3: The taster joked that they had the 'taste buds of a superhero.'
meanings.sent4: Her tongue was a taster of all things delicious in the world.
meanings.sent5: The taster's job was to savor each bite and sip with precision.

meanings.definition: A small sample of food or drink taken to assess its flavor.
meanings.sent1: She offered a taster of the new ice cream flavor to the customers.
meanings.sent2: The bakery provided free tasters of their freshly baked cookies.
meanings.sent3: The taster of the spicy sauce made his eyes water unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: The taster of adventure left her craving more excitement.
meanings.sent5: The tiny taster of the soup revealed a burst of flavors in her mouth.

meanings.definition: A person who is employed to taste and assess food or drink.
meanings.sent1: The company hired a professional taster to review their menu.
meanings.sent2: The chocolate factory employed a taster to ensure quality.
meanings.sent3: The taster's dream job was to eat chocolate all day.
meanings.sent4: She became a taster and explored a world of culinary delights.
meanings.sent5: The taster's feedback helped the chef perfect the dish.
